description: The men were among 31 soldiers killed when their C-46 transport plane hit a cliff while attempting to land in Okinawa, Japan on Aug. 13, 1945
title: WWII soldiers posthumously receive Purple Heart medals

description: The experience backcountry skier was traveling on Donaldson Peak in Idaho's Lost River Range when they triggered a slope collapse.
title: Backcountry skier killed after buried by avalanche in Idaho

description: The European Broadcasting Union said Swedish police were investigating "a complaint made by a female member of the production crew" against Klein.
title: Dutch contestant Joost Klein kicked out of Eurovision hours before final

description: New White House report says Israel may have violated international humanitarian law in Gaza; How chef Fermin Nunez is changing the culinary scene in Austin, Texas
title: 5/11: Saturday Morning

description: Tens of thousands​ of transborder students — some as young as kindergarteners — cross the border from Mexico into California, Arizona, New Mexico and Texas to pursue an education in the United States.
title: Transborder students who crossed from Mexico to U.S. set to graduate

description: A'ja Wilson, of the Las Vegas Aces, has joined a roster of women athletes who have partnered with Nike to develop signature collections.
title: Nike announces signature shoe for WNBA star A'ja Wilson

description: Kentucky Derby winner Mystik Dan is heading to the Preakness after all.
title: Kentucky Derby winner Mystik Dan to race at the Preakness

description: Minnesota officially adopted its new state flag on Saturday, making the old flag history. So what happens to the old flag now that it is obsolete?
title: Minnesota is officially flying its new flag. What happens to the old one?

description: The shooting occurred on Friday night inside a Regal Cinemas theater in Ohio, according to police.
title: 1 dead after shooting inside Ohio movie theater, police say

description: David Begaud heads to a surprise city on a mission to find a story in 48 hours – and he meets three strangers with powerful messages to share. A heroic cowboy teaches a lesson in modesty. Plus, more heartwarming news stories.
title: The Uplift: Strangers in San Antonio

description: In Washington, D.C., we meet two figure skaters who are expanding access to the sport to other Black college students. Then in California, UFC legend Ronda Rousey opens up about her life and career in her vulnerable new memoir. Watch these stories and more on Eye on America with host Michelle Miller.
title: Eye on America: Black figure skaters make history, and Ronda Rousey’s revealing new memoir

description: Actor Tiffany Haddish may have had her big break in the 2016 comedy "Girls Trip," but she spent decades working in the industry before that. Now a winner of two Grammys and an Emmy Award, Haddish has released her third book, "I Curse You With Joy." Michelle Miller has more.
title: Actor Tiffany Haddish on new book "I Curse You With Joy"

description: The National Inventors Hall of Fame inducted their class of 2024 this year, honoring living and historical pioneers in science. Among them are patent holders in areas like biotech, agriculture, and magic — or the means to magical moments. Meet Lanny Smoot, the inventor of over 100 patents whose boundless sense of wonder fuels his creations.
title: Meet Lanny Smoot, the inventor with over 100 patents

description: Native Fashion Week designers embraced the runway, juxtaposing modernity and traditional Native ceremony.
title: Indigenous fashion takes the runway with an eye to history — and the future

description: Singer-songwriter Katie Pruitt garnered widespread acclaim for her introspective music and powerful live performances after releasing her first album in 2020. Rolling Stone even declared her an "artist you need to know." Now returning to Saturday Sessions with music from her new album "Mantras," here is Katie Pruitt with "White Lies, White Jesus And You."
title: Saturday Sessions: Katie Pruitt performs "White Lies, White Jesus and You"

description: Chef Fermin Nunez is helping transform the culinary scene in Austin, Texas, with colorful and inventive recipes that use flavors from Mexico to highlight Texan dishes. After starting his first restaurant in 2018, Nunez has opened two more wildly successful establishments and picked up some prestigious awards along the way.
title: How chef Fermin Nunez is changing the culinary scene in Austin, Texas

description: Singer-songwriter Katie Pruitt garnered widespread acclaim for her introspective music and powerful live performances after releasing her first album in 2020. Rolling Stone even declared her an "artist you need to know." Now returning to Saturday Sessions with music from her new album "Mantras," here is Katie Pruitt with "Worst Case Scenario."
title: Saturday Sessions: Katie Pruitt performs "Worst Case Scenario"

description: Singer-songwriter Katie Pruitt garnered widespread acclaim for her introspective music and powerful live performances after releasing her first album in 2020. Rolling Stone even declared her an "artist you need to know." Now returning to Saturday Sessions with music from her new album "Mantras," here is Katie Pruitt with "All My Friends."
title: Saturday Sessions: Katie Pruitt performs "All My Friends"

description: The new book by the host of HBO's "Real Time" takes aim at those who brazenly invoke the standards of today to rewrite history in ways that even "Star Trek" would think go too far.
title: Book excerpt: "What This Comedian Said Will Shock You" by Bill Maher

description: While officials work to keep politics out of the event, the Israel-Hamas war has led to controversy this year.
title: What is Eurovision? Everything to know about the European song contest

description: When she launched in 1936, the Queen Mary was the world's largest passenger ship. No expense was spared in constructing the luxury liner, but by the 1980s, she had been relegated for use as a tourist attraction in Long Beach, California. Decades of neglect led to calls for her to be scrapped, but an outpouring of local support and millions of dollars in upgrades mean the ship is once again welcoming guests.
title: Restoring the Queen Mary, one of the world's most famous passenger ships

description: A line of family, friends and loved ones filled a North Texas home to celebrate Viola Ford Fletcher's birthday.
title: Oldest Tulsa Massacre survivor celebrates 110th birthday in North Texas

description: Eighty-four million Americans had a mental disorder in 2022, while 34 million people had a substance use disorder. About 11 million people dealt with both, but many did not receive professional treatment, partially because of a persistent stigma leading to silence and shame around mental health problems. Michelle Miller reports on how former congressman Patrick J. Kennedy and author Stephen Fried are hoping to make change with their new book.
title: Patrick J. Kennedy works to reduce stigma around mental health, substance use with new book

description: Sean "Diddy" Combs is asking a judge to dismiss a lawsuit alleging that he and two other men raped a 17-year-old girl in a New York recording studio in 2003.
title: Sean "Diddy" Combs asks judge to dismiss sexual assault lawsuit

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, lifestyle expert Elizabeth Werner shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: Amazon rolled out the first of its planned fleet of long-haul electric trucks in Los Angeles this week, but the company already has a large amount of electronic vehicles rolling through much of the country, delivering hundreds of millions of packages.
title: Inside Amazon's electric delivery trucks

description: Early voting is underway this morning in Maryland for a primary election for a seat in the U.S. House. U.S. Capitol Police officer Harry Dunn — who became a national figure after the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol — is on the ballot, and today's election could be an early test of what kind of candidate voters are looking for in 2024.
title: Maryland House race could show what voters are looking for in 2024

description: North Korea in recent months has maintained an accelerated pace in weapons testing as it expands its military capabilities while diplomacy with the United States and South Korea remains stalled.
title: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversees test of new multiple rocket launcher

description: A new, highly-awaited report from the Biden administration says Israel may have violated international humanitarian law in Gaza, but stopped short of a definitive assessment of wrongdoing. The report is drawing intense backlash from both political parties.
title: New White House report says Israel may have violated international humanitarian law in Gaza

description: Since the summer of 2020, dozens of schools in the nation named for Confederate leaders have changed their names, but this week, a Virginia school district has become likely the first in the nation to reverse course. The Shenandoah County school board overwhelmingly voted to restore the names of Confederate leaders to a high school and an elementary school.
title: Virginia school district votes to restore Confederate names to two schools

description: Former President Donald Trump will return to a New York City courtroom on Monday for his ongoing criminal hush money trial. His former attorney and one-time fixer Michael Cohen, a key witness for the prosecution, is expected to take the stand days after adult film star Stormy Daniels testified.
title: Michael Cohen to take the stand in Trump hush money trial

description: Parts of the country saw the aurora borealis on Friday night and the dazzling show will continue on Saturday night, according to officials.
title: Northern lights set the sky aglow amid powerful geomagnetic storm

description: Incredible Northern lights set the sky ablaze on Friday night, with some vibrant colors even visible to the naked eye amid a geomagnetic storm. Meanwhile, a protest in Germany at a Tesla factory turned into a stampede. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Northern lights set the sky aglow worldwide

description: The United Nations and other agencies have warned for weeks that an Israeli assault on Rafah, which borders Egypt near the main aid entry points, would cripple humanitarian operations
title: Israel orders new evacuations in Rafah, forcing tens of thousands to move

description: The Carolina Hurricanes must win Game 4 against the NY Rangers tonight or face elimination from Stanley Cup Playoffs.
title: How to watch the New York Rangers vs. Carolina Hurricanes NHL Playoffs game tonight: Game 4 livestream options

description: The U.N. food agency says more than 300 Afghans have died in flash floods that also destroyed more than 1,000 houses in the northern province of Baghlan.
title: Flash floods in northern Afghanistan killed more than 300 people, U.N. says

description: At the same time, the three are accusing each other of being pro-transgender.
title: 3 GOP candidates for WVA governor try to outdo each other on anti-LGBTQ issues

description: Find how and when to watch the exciting Game 3 showdown between the Boston Celtics and Cleveland Cavaliers tonight.
title: How to watch the Boston Celtics vs. Cleveland Cavaliers NBA Playoffs game tonight: Game 3 livestream options

description: Hinge is one of the most popular dating apps, so we signed up. Read our review to find out if you should too.
title: Is Hinge a good dating app? We tried it and found out

description: From meal kits to monthly makeup subscriptions, give Mom a last-minute virtual gift that can be delivered online.
title: 10 digital Mother's Day gift ideas so your 2024 gift can reach her in time

description: Find out how and when to watch Game 3 of the Oklahoma City Thunder vs. Dallas Mavericks NBA Playoffs series today.
title: How to watch the OKC Thunder vs. Dallas Mavericks NBA Playoffs game today: Game 3 livestream options, more

description: Florida Panhandle residents deal with aftermath of destructive winds; Mom refuses to give up on daughter put on life support after car crash
title: 5/10: CBS Evening News

description: Actress Nicola Coughlan told Anthony Mason about her acting journey, landing popular roles in "Derry Girls" and "Bridgerton," connecting with audiences and more in a sitdown interview at Lady Mendl's Tea Salon in New York City. "I think it doesn't really matter what you make — you want people to feel something," said Coughlan, adding that it's a "beautiful thing" to take people to another world.
title: Extended interview: Nicola Coughlan on journey from "Derry Girls" to "Bridgerton" and beyond

description: "We're not investing in students' future by engaging in relationships with companies that profit from war," Sacramento State University President Luke Wood told CBS News.
title: Sacramento State's unique approach helps bring peaceful end to campus protest

description: Peggy Means' only daughter was in a coma with virtually no chance of ever coming out of it, doctors told her. And yet, Means refused to let them pull the plug.
title: Woman to celebrate first Mother's Day at home since emerging from 5-year coma

description: Different colleges have taken different approaches to handling campus protests, with very different outcomes. Sacramento State's response stands out. Elise Preston had an exclusive interview with the university's president, one of the first to sit down to talk about the protests.
title: How one college says it ended campus Gaza protests with dialogue

description: In a reversal experts believe was the first of its kind, Shenandoah County's school board voted 5-1 to rename Mountain View High School as Stonewall Jackson High School and Honey Run Elementary as Ashby Lee Elementary.
title: Virginia school district restores names of Confederate generals to 2 schools

description: Peggy Means' only daughter was in a coma with virtually no chance of ever coming out of it, doctors told her. And yet, Means refused to let them pull the plug. Steve Hartman has the incredible story in "On the Road."
title: Mom refuses to give up on daughter put on life support after car crash

description: An alternate angle showed that the water bottle was not intentionally thrown at Novak Djokovic, but slipped out of a backpack as a fan leaned over to high five the tour's top ranked player.
title: Novak Djokovic accidentally struck in head by metal water bottle

description: Geomagnetic storms can affect infrastructure, but may also bring an expanded viewing of the aurora borealis.
title: Geomagnetic storm may disrupt power, but expand aurora viewing

description: Authorities in Russia say seven people were killed when a bus swerved through traffic, veered off a bridge in St. Petersburg and plunged into the river below.
title: Video shows bus in Russia plunge off bridge in deadly crash

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken has delivered to Congress a highly-anticipated report on Israel's military operations in Gaza. The State Department investigation found no humanitarian law violations by Israel, but determined that "it is reasonable to assess" that some U.S. weapons may have been used in manners "inconsistent" with those laws. Ramy Inocencio reports.
title: U.S. weapons possibly used in ways "inconsistent" with international law in Gaza, report says
